name: Diane's Final Year Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 5 | 25 Questions

questions.text: Possibly, an easier question to start with. At the end of season 4, Sam either proposed to Diane or Janet. Which person did he propose to?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Sam proposed over the phone, and then again on a boat.

questions.text: Who played Ester Clavin, Cliff's mother?
questions.explanation:
Frances Sternhagen.

	Ma Clavin is not your typical mother. She's always reminding Cliff of his downfalls.

questions.text: What does Frasier say to Lilith in "Abnormal Psychology" when Lilith takes her hair down?
options: Let's pretend we're both Freudians and talk about sex
questions.explanation:
I'm going to kiss you.

	"I'm going to kiss you. I'm gonna kiss you long and hard, but make no mistake I am going to kiss you."  I put the comment about Freud in the wrong answers because Frasier is a Freudian. Lilith however is a Behaviorist.

questions.text: Why was the house Carla bought so cheep?
options: There was lots of lead based paint in the house.
questions.explanation:
It was near an airport.

	It was over a graveyard, but the reason it was so cheap was because it was so close to the airport.

questions.text: What color socks does Cliff wear?
questions.explanation:
white.

	This could be asked for any episode, but I picked it with "Tan N Wash" in mind. Cliff says "Look how white I used to be" and pulls his socks down showing how white he was before the tanning booth. The socks he pulls down are white.

questions.text: In "Young Dr. Weinstein" when Diane says she's eating in "the café" what does Sam say he's driving home in?
questions.explanation:
the car.

	Sam pretends to be a doctor to get into the restaurant that Diane is going to because she told him he couldn't get in.

questions.text: What is the rule that turns Norm off of the "Knights of Scimitar"?
questions.explanation:
No drinking.

	They do have a rule against business with other members, but Norm is able to over look that rule. He is not going to stay when they say no drinking however.

questions.text: Where is the Thanksgiving dinner held in "Thanksgiving Orphan"?
questions.explanation:
Carla's house.

	This episode is the one that has the food fight. It was Rhea Perlman's (Carla) favorite episode.

questions.text: Who wrote the poem that Sam got published?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane wrote it to him in a love letter when they were dating. She's touched that he saved her love letters, but he claims he didn't save them he just happened to find that one at his house. Then we see him putting it back with all the other letters.

questions.text: Who plays Beth Curtis, Woody's old girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
Amanda Wyss.

	All these actresses appeared in this episode of "Cheers". Wyss played Beth however. McGrath played Deseriee, Hedges played Tina and Chase played a woman in the bar.

questions.text: Who wrote "Dance, Diane, Dance"?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Abugov.

	Dan Gerrity played the choreographer in this episode. James Burrows directed this episode (as well as most of the other episodes). Glen and Les Charles are the producers of the show.

questions.text: In "Chambers Vs. Malone" what does Diane refer to Sam as in the trial?
questions.explanation:
the accused.

	Diane: "The accused..." Sam: "Make her say my name, Sam, my name is Sam."

questions.text: What character does Al Rosen play in "Diamond Sam" (according to the credits)?
questions.explanation:
The Man Who Said Sinatra.

	In many of the earlier episodes, like this one, Al Rosen was not credited as Al, but as "The Man Who Said Sinatra".

questions.text: Who wrote the episode entitle "Spellbound"?
questions.explanation:
Kimberly Hill.

	Jean Kasem played Loretta in this episode.

questions.text: In "Never Love A Goalie - Part I" who was the foreman of the jury?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	This episode introduced Jay Thomas as Eddie Lebec.

questions.text: Why does Carla dump Eddie in "Never Love a Goalie - Part II"?
questions.correct: She thinks she's a jinx to his game play
options: She is going back to Nick Tortelli
She doesn't think he's good enough
questions.explanation:
She thinks she's a jinx to his game play.

	Carla dumps Eddie before every game so that he will play well.

questions.text: How does Sam describe Diane's earlobes in "Last Fling"?
questions.explanation:
insensitive.

	He says this when he's talking to the guys about having to spend the rest of his life with one woman. He says "One pair of earlobes, and not even sensitive ones."

questions.text: In "Dog Bites Cliff" what is the name of the woman whose dog bit Cliff?
questions.explanation:
Madeline Keith.

	Anita Morris played Madeline Keith. Roxie Hart has nothing to do with "Cheers". She was the lead character in "Chicago".

questions.text: In "Dinner at Eight-ish" who is the first person to lock themselves inside the bathroom?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	Out of the four, Sam is the only one who doesn't, at some point, lock himself in the bathroom, but Lilith was first.

questions.text: Who played Dr. Simon Finch-Royce in "Simon Says"?
questions.explanation:
John Cleese.

	The Monty Python member who guest starred on "Cheers" was none other than the great John Cleese.

questions.text: What is the name of Sam's godchild who comes to visit in "The Godfather, Part III"?
questions.explanation:
Joyce.

	Joyce was played by Cady McClain.

questions.text: What word best describes Norm's office in "Norm's Big Hurrah"?
questions.explanation:
closet.

	The gang is surprised when they come to visit Norm.

questions.text: Who sends Woody's parents a letter that causes his parents to allow Woody to stay in Boston?
questions.explanation:
Al.

	Woody: "I wish I knew who sent the letter so I could thank them."Al: "Don't mention it kid."

questions.text: Complete this line from when they show Sam and Diane as an old couple. Sam: "I'll get it, _________________."
questions.explanation:
maybe not.

	When Sam is old it's hard for him to get up once he's down.

questions.text: "I Do, Adieu" is Shelley Long's last episode (not counting the 2 guest appearances) on "Cheers". Sam speaks the last line of the episode, what does he say?
questions.explanation: Have a good life.
